summary.intent: User wanted to verify if a TODO comment was still relevant, and if not, remove it and commit the change.
summary.outcome: Identified and removed a stale TODO comment about deferred condensation (already implemented in task #1), verified another TODO was still valid, then committed and pushed the changes after rebasing on remote updates.

repo: TODO(ENT-221) items track specific enhancement work - some relate to deferred condensation (now complete), others to stale session warnings (still pending)
The codebase uses a state machine pattern with transitions like ACTIVE_COMMITTED → IDLE that trigger condensation actions

code.finding: transitionSessionTurnEnd already dispatches ActionCondense for ACTIVE_COMMITTED → IDLE via HandleTurnEnd, making the TODO about implementing this functionality stale

workflow: When remote has new commits during push, the workflow is to pull/rebase first then push again

friction: Had to rebase and retry push when remote had new commits
open_items: TODO(ENT-221) for ActionWarnStaleSession - warning when re-entering a session still in ACTIVE state remains valid future work
